The '''Morgulduin''' was a river of [[Gondor]] that began in [[Morgul Vale]] in the [[Ephel Dúath]]. It ran westward past [[Minas Morgul]] until it reached the [[Cross-roads]] in [[Ithilien]], where its course turned southwest until it entered the [[Anduin]] just south of [[Osgiliath]]. Just to the north of the stream was the [[Morgul-road|road]] from Osgiliath to Minas Morgul.<ref>{{RK|Map}}</ref>

==History==
It is probable that the original name of the river was Ithilduin<ref>{{WR|2|VII}}, "Duin Morghul - formerly Ithilduin", p. 181</ref> and that it was renamed Morgulduin at the same time as Minas Ithil was renamed Minas Morgul after [[Second Fall of Minas Ithil|its capture]] by the [[Nazgûl]] in {{TA|2002}}.<ref>{{App|TA}}, entry for the year 2002, p. 1087</ref><ref>{{FR|Council}}, pp. 244-5</ref>
[[File:The Lord of the Rings - The Return of the King - Morgulduin.png|thumb|250px|right|The Morgulduin in ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King]]'']]
On March 9, {{TA|3019}}<ref>{{App|Great}}, entry for the year 3019, March 9, p. 1093</ref> as [[Frodo Baggins|Frodo]], [[Samwise Gamgee|Sam]], and [[Gollum]] were approaching the Cross-roads they heard the voice of the river, which sounded cold and cruel.<ref>{{TT|Journey}}, p. 697</ref> At the time of the [[War of the Ring]] the water from the river was not suitable for drinking.<ref>{{TT|Journey}}, p. 694</ref> Near the bridge over the river some way into the Morgul Vale cold vapours issued from the river who sickened Frodo<ref>{{TT|Stairs}}, p. 704</ref> on March 10.<ref>{{App|Great}}, entry for the year 3019, March 10, p. 1093</ref>

==Etymology==
It has been suggested that ''Morgulduin'' is a [[Sindarin]] name meaning "black magic river" and consisting of ''[[morn|mor(n)]]'' ("dark", "black"), ''[[gûl|gul]]'' ("magic", "necromancy") and ''[[duin]]'' ("river").<ref>{{webcite|author=Association Tolkiendil|articleurl=http://www.tolkiendil.com/langues/english/i-lam_arth/compound_sindarin_names|articlename=Compound Sindarin Names in Middle-earth|dated=|website=[http://www.tolkiendil.com Tolkiendil.com]|accessed=3 January 2012}}</ref>

''Ithilduin'' is a Sindarin name. Its meaning is not glossed, but Roman Rausch suggests that it means "moon-river" and consists of ''[[ithil]]'' ("moon") and ''[[duin]]'' ("river").<ref>{{webcite|author=Roman Rausch|articleurl=http://www.sindanoorie.net/art/RS_TI_WR_Ithilduin.html|articlename=2.46 Ithilduin, Duin Morghul|dated=|website=[http://www.sindanoorie.net Sindanoorie.net]|accessed=26 January 2022}}</ref>

==Portrayal in adaptations==
'''2015: ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'':'''
:Morgulduin originates above the [[Minas Morgul]] in the former cisterns of the city, now corrupted into "Eithel Gwaur", the Filth-well. Its River-maiden "Rauniel" was killed and devoured by a creature that now lives in and pollutes her domain. The corruption of the river is unmistakable along its course, even after it flows out of the [[Morgul Vale]] into [[Ithilien]], with only the mighty current of the [[Anduin]] itself able to safely dillute the poisoned waters.
